sources:
the Bathhouse in the Spirited Away movie is based on many different places. Such as the Taiwan's Jiufen and Japan's Dogo Onsen in Matsuyama. I found the photo comparing the film's scene and the Jiufen's street photo in the website below. It is highly similar. 

http://en.rocketnews24.com/2012/12/18/%E3%80%90photos%E3%80%91-taiwans-jiufen-the-real-world-inspiration-for-studio-ghiblis-spirited-away/

The research is based on this website. 
http://kotaku.com/visit-the-real-princess-mononoke-forest-1282488846

From the article
it said Hayao Mizazaki traveled to the Yakushima Island and get inspired by the thousands years old forest. From the picture posted on the site
The forest of the deer god was inspired by trips to the forests of Yakushima. http://www.ghibli.jp/diary_m/948-955.html - https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Princess_Mononoke#cite_note-ProductionDiary1-9
it is very reasonable to think that the movie is based on this island.
